required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of an Ascensia Lancing System
clinical_study.official_title: User Performance of the Styx Lancing System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to determine if untrained subjects with diabetes could perform basic tasks with the Styx lancing device to obtain adequate blood volume from fingerstick and palm lancings for Blood Glucose Meter testing.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Numeric Meter Results When Users Obtain Fingerstick Capillary Blood Using the Styx Lancing Device ( 28 Gauge Lancets)
primary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects with Diabetes operated the Styx Lancing Device with 28 Gauge lancets to obtain fingerstick capillary blood. Study Staff tested the capillary blood using Contour NEXT Blood Glucose Meters (BGMs) and recorded the results. Meter results could be numeric, non-numeric (ie, error messages), or not obtained at all. The number of subjects with numeric BGMS results was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Numeric Meter Results When Users Obtain Alternate Site (AST) Palm Blood Using the Styx Lancing Device ( 28 Gauge Lancets)
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects with Diabetes operated the Styx Lancing Device with 28 Gauge lancets to obtain AST palm capillary blood. Study Staff tested the capillary blood using Contour NEXT Blood Glucose Meters (BGMs) and recorded the results. Meter results could be numeric, non-numeric (ie, error messages), or not obtained at all. The number of subjects with numeric BGMS results was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Numeric Meter Results When Users Obtain Fingerstick Capillary Blood Using the Styx Lancing Device ( 30 Gauge Lancets)
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects with Diabetes operated the Styx Lancing Device with 30 Gauge lancets to obtain fingerstick capillary blood. Study Staff tested the capillary blood using Contour NEXT Blood Glucose Meters (BGMs) and recorded the results. Meter results could be numeric, non-numeric (ie, error messages), or not obtained at all. The number of subjects with numeric BGMS results was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Numeric Meter Results When Users Obtain Alternate Site (AST) Palm Blood Using the Styx Lancing Device ( 30 Gauge Lancets)
secondary_outcome.description: Untrained subjects with Diabetes operated the Styx Lancing Device with 30 Gauge lancets to obtain AST palm capillary blood. Study Staff tested the capillary blood using Contour NEXT Blood Glucose Meters (BGMs) and recorded the results. Meter results could be numeric, non-numeric (ie, error messages), or not obtained at all. The number of subjects with numeric BGMS results was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Responses From Persons With Diabetes That Either 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or Are 'Neutral' With Questionnaire Statements Regarding the Styx Lancing Device
secondary_outcome.description: Staff obtained responses from persons with Diabetes using short questionnaires to provide feedback on instructions for use and the basic operation of the Styx Lancing Device. Subjects could respond 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or are 'Neutral' or 'Disagree' or 'Strongly Disagree'. The percent of subjects who provided responses that were 'Strongly Agree' or 'Agree' or 'Neutral' about each statement was calculated.

arm_group.description: Untrained Persons with Diabetes used the Styx Lancing Device System to obtain fingerstick and Alternate Site palm capillary blood.

intervention.description: Untrained Persons With Diabetes used the Styx Lancing Device with 28 and 30 Gauge lancets to obtain fingerstick and Alternate Site palm capillary blood. Study Staff tested the capillary blood using Contour NEXT Blood Glucose Meters (BGMs) and recorded the results. Meter results could be numeric, non-numeric (ie, error messages), or not obtained at all.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females, 18 years of age and older
- People with type 1 or type 2 diabetes
- People who regularly perform self-tests (at least once/day) with their own lancing device
- Able to speak, read, and understand English
- Willing to complete all study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Those with missing tips of the fingers indicated in the protocol or physically unable to lance the palm areas and all the fingers indicated in the protocol.
- Hemophilia or any other bleeding disorder
- Pregnancy
- Physical, visual or neurological impairments that would make the person unable to perform testing
- Persons who have used the Styx device in a previous clinical evaluation
- Working for a competitive medical device company, or having an immediate family member who works for such a company
- A condition which, in the opinion of the investigator or designee, would put the person or study conduct at risk

outcome.population: 118 (119-1) Subject results were analyzed. One subject result was not evaluable because staff deviated from protocol by interfering with subject operation of the device.

class.title: I can follow the device instructional insert
I find the lancing device easy to use
I find it easy to insert the lancet into the devic
I can attach the Black Adjustable Endcap
I am able to do a fingerstick with this device
I can remove the Clear AST endcap
Easy to remove lancet without removing w fingers
I like the overall design of the lancing device
Easy / intuitive to do a fingerstick w this device

event.description: Subject's hypoglycemia was resolved at this visit

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
